data.title: Reasonable prices for fresh food
data.text: I have been her only for lunch twice.  Everything has been tasty.  The mussels were very good.  The portions are reasonable for one.  The atmosphere is very, very basic.  The price is reasonable as you are paying for the quality of the food and not the decor.

data.title: Not Chinese food
data.text: This a very small restaurant that always has a line ! That should tell you something . They serve sandwiches that come with side salads . This was our 3rd visit . For appetizers we ordered fried green tomatoes, jumbo grilled prawns (to die for) beer battered onion rings(delicious),truffle Parmesan fries( you have to try these). We ordered the po boy New Orleans style ,albacore tuna melt,and the chow burger.for our sides we went with Caesar salad. For dessert we shared the chocolate banana bread pudding . The servers were awesome and the food delicious . I noticed take out was very busy too.

data.title: Wonderful Food
data.text: Lunch at Eat Chow is great.  The food is excellent, those sweet potatoe fries - yum.  The sandwiches are large and the ingrediants fresh.  There are three separate places to sit, outside, main restaurant and the inside next to the store.  We sat inside next to the store, than goodness because the middle area is really noisy.

data.title: Meeting - Dinner
data.text: Had dinner here with some co workers. Service was fantastic, dinner was hot and the food was great. Absolutely recommend this place if you are in the area.

data.title: Lots of options.  Good food.  Small very casual spot.
data.text:
This is a small, very casual, restaurant that could use some updating on the interior (looks a little worn) but the food is very good.  The menu provides a lot of options.   Four of us met for lunch here and had the following:
-	Grilled Artichoke - good
-	Cheesy Tots – ok to share but too rich to eat it all 
-	Truffle Mac and Cheese – also very rich
-	Pan Seared Salmon sandwich – very good other than the asparagus which was not cooked enough
-	Baja Fish Tacos - good
-	Herb Roasted Half Chicken – tender and moist
-	Crispy Beef Tacos - good
-	Peach Cobbler – good

With so many items to choose from, this will be on our list for a return visit if we are in the area.

data.title: A must
data.text: The best little tucked away hole in the wall in Costa Mesa you must check this place out for lunch or dinner absolutely spectacular

data.title: Amazeballs!
data.text: This is a must try place! It's small so the wait may be a little long but totally worth it!  Try the short rib tostadas and the amazing tacos with the blueberry habanero salsa!!!

data.title: Lunch
data.text:
Great place for lunch and breakfast amazing food 
Always busy 
Went on Saturday morning 
Service was great and large portions of food

data.title: Lunch
data.text: A very cool and trendy spot to grab a bite in COSTA MESA. Parking is a bit tough on the street but if you travel around the block there is usually plenty of parking out back. Food comes a little slow but has been EXCELLENT every time I have gone and that numbers about 6 now. I love the Burger and the Parmesan Truffle Fries 😋

data.title: Delicious food and beautifully prepared!
data.text: We ate here for breakfast, and the food was served as if in the finest restaurant! Kind serving staff as well. We enjoyed our meal here!

data.title: Breakfast before a flight home.
data.text:
This place was great. This was my second time here. Small place but very friendly staff. 

I had the eggs and sausage plate. Came out hot and was delicious. 

Coffee was fresh

Will definitely be back when I'm in the area again.

data.title: Fantastic breakfast!
data.text: What a great find! Lots of unique selections on the breakfast menu. I had the pulled pork and poached eggs. Very unique and tasty! It was really nice being able to sit on the front sidewalk and enjoy the sunshine!

data.title: Love this Restaurant!
data.text: The food here is incredible!!  This is a rather small restaurant and you often have to wait for a table.  If the wait were shorter, we would be back more often!  Try their delicious ceviche.  It's so outstanding.

data.title: Always yummy!
data.text:
Everything is so yummy! I love the mix it of flavors and atmosphere 
There is always a fabulous new special to taste 
Enjoy!

data.title: "Trendy" place for an okay meal
data.text: This place is TINY with no real space for even the waiters to get through without bumping into patrons. I guess if i was a hipster this place would be great but I am not and this place is not in my opinion. The food was below average to me but the kicker was being put into a small corner to eat with no space to my sides or back to people. I understand wanting to fit people in as much as possible but the space here has to be a hazard when full and people all get up to leave. But again, below average food and just not for me.

data.title: Casual Breakfast
data.text: My wife and I went for  leisure breakfast on a nice cool Sunday after the New Year at this eating establishment. The place was very popular but we were lucky to get seat for 2 inside. The breakfast was interesting. I had a Chow Egg Benedicts. The eggs were cooked perfectly with the fully cooked white egg and creamy egg yolk. My wife had a French toast which she was saying that it was too soaky. The service was professional and friendly. I recommend that you should go early since when we left the place there were already a long line in a waiting.

data.title: Lunch for Five
data.text: We had heard that Eat Chow has very good breakfasts, but we couldn’t get there until lunch time.  It is a funky place and one I wouldn’t have even noticed when driving by except that my niece liked it and joined us for lunch.  The restaurant is small and it was crowded (no outside eating that day, it was raining) but we got seated after a short wait.  It was well worth the wait.  The white bean hummus ($6.50) as perfectly seasoned.  The tuna sandwich ($9) was piled high with albacore tuna.  The BLTA ($9) bacon was perfectly crispy; and the Media Nohce Cuban sandwich ($10) was the best I have ever eaten.  We split a bottle of Malbec ($28) while one of us had an IPA beer ($7).  Service was spot on.  Next time I would like to try the breakfast.

data.title: One of the Best Places to Eat in OC
data.text:
Wow, how have I not eaten here until now???  This place is so AMAZING!   It's hard to find since you can't see it from Newport Blvd (it's visible from W 18th St), but if you can find this hidden gem you definitely need to scope it out!  It's very small inside and doesn't seat a lot, but if you come early, you're good to go.  

I came here in a Wednesday night around 5:30 PM, and it wasn't busy.  I was seated right away and the service was on top of it.  The soup of the day was lentil soup (yum!), so it already got me excited about dinner.  I don't recall the name of our service staff members that helped us, but it was one of the best service I've ever received.  Water glasses were never empty, they checked up on us enough times without being annoyingly frequent, and they were so hospitable and friendly throughout the whole dining experience.

What I Ordered:
Sweet potato fries ($5.50): Delicious!  It was topped with cotija cheese and a side of ketchup.
Lentil soup ($6 for a bowl, $4 for a cup): Nice and hot for a cold California night.  There were enough lentils in there so you know that you're getting your fiber and protein kick and enough soup to make it take oh so good.
French Dip ($13): Very good!  Not the best I ever had as the meat was a bit dryer than I anticipated, but after dipping it in the au jus, it just made it that much better.  I'd probably give this 4/5.  Still nice and juicy when you dip it!  this comes with a side of mixed greens or Caesar salad.

My friend had the Chicken Curry Salad, which he thoroughly enjoyed.  He said he loved the curry dressing, as it had the right amount of spice.  Appetizers were under $6, most entrees loomed between $10-$17, and desserts were around $8.  

Now that I know dinner is legit, I have to come here for breakfast one day.  Or even have a burger there for lunch.  Everything on the menu looks soooo good!  The noise level can be a bit high, and the table s are thisclose to each other, so it may not provide you the best intimate conversations with whoever you come with.  However, the ambiance is quite trendy and nice.  Highly recommend if you like a diverse menu of goodness and awesome, top notch service!

data.title: Sunday fun day
data.text:
Great breakfast menu! Amal & cozy with about 25 seat inside & 10 seating outside. It get busy over the weekend and there will be a short Waite to get in. 
Wife had egg Benedict & I went with the breakfast burrito.
We both liked our food , it's fresh and tested good.the only thing to say negative about the place it's the prices a bit over price in place that you almost sharing your table with others and not much of privacy!
With all said we will back again and recommended to our grinds as well.

data.title: Quirky place
data.text: How many times do you find a restaurant in a baby store. You might think it wouldn't be good but it is yum. I ordered the macaroni and cheese extraordinaire. My husband loved the shrimp poboy. Both of us got the Ceasar salad and it was great too.
